list_definition.mean_english: khăn quàng vai, khăn thắt lưng
list_definition.definition: a broad band of cloth worn round the waist, or over one shoulder

list_ex_of_definition.ex_of_definition: a white dress with a red sash at the waist.

list_definition.definition: a frame fitted with glass, forming part of a window

list_ex_of_english: The four basement windows have single sashes of nine panes each.
The windows are sashes and originally had wooden shutters.
Handcrafts include textiles such as blankets, sashes, rugs, cushions, tablecloths, carrying bags and quezqumetls made of wool.
Usually the dipping process is useful in the treatment of window sashes and doors.
The timber windows and sashes were to be 1.5 inches (38mm) thick.
By 1804, the building needed significant repairs and was renovated with new doors, window sashes, ladders, and the roof was repainted.
The house has been greatly altered and was refronted on the south-west elevation in the nineteenth century with 3 window range of double-hung sashes.
Concrete balconies enclosed with steel sashes replaced existing wooden galleries, and a three-story brick addition enclosed a steel stair.
